name: killerlimpet
text: phonograph and 8-track too

name: dallovich
text: Love the fact that it's most likely because he overheard that people in africa are poor, and made the assumption that it's nothing more serious than them not being able to afford cds.

name: dumase
text:
I can understand why people like listening to records, because it's got that unique sound that you're not going to get from anything else.
But why in god's name would you listen to tapes? They make everything sound like a bad concert where the band's soundguy had to go to a wedding, so they brought some random along on tour who knows NOTHING about music.

name: semiquaver
text: is SO true

name: kaithekender
text: Am I alone in not being able to tell the difference between the same song on vinyl, Cassette, CD, or MP3? Because they all sound identical to me.

name: scifigrl47
text: No, you are not alone.  I am with you.  I am that tone deaf and ignorant.  I like sounds.  Musical sounds.  But that's about all I can discern, no matter what the source of those sounds.

name: libelandslander
text: I like how this comment seems to imply that we jumped directly from cassette to MP3, as if CDs never existed.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: UPDATE: I now have an iPod and thusly rarely listen to tapes anymore. *BUT*, I do use a cassette adapter to play my iPod in the car... Does that make me cool?

name: greenkoolayd
text: this is like the past and the future kissing.  each other.  getting all warm and letting hands roam and stuff...

name: breadcrab
text: The cassette player is king of make-outs.

name: liquidcruelty
text: oh my god I'm so sorry I meant to chubby not lame oh god oh god can i take it back

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Awesome Tapes from Africa

name: slab64
text: Teodor is right - it IS hard to care about tree pain.

name: spinynorman
text:
That's become one of my favorite stock responses. "Yes, but in a way that's hard to care about."

Alternate version: "No."

name: awko
text:
"If trees could scream, would we be so cavalier about cutting them down? We might, if they screamed all the time, for no good reason."

-Jack Handey

name: soticoto
text:
Trees do scream. They scream in chemicals rather than sounds. You can SMELL tree-pain in the air when they're hurt.
Fact.

name: geysershitdick
text: High five a mortician this week.

name: hipjiverobot
text:
Won't somebody please think of the morticians?

Seriously, does anyone plan to be a mortician, or does it just sort of happen?

name: anitrophaeron
text: During my "I want to be a doctor" phase, I was leaning heavily toward mortician just because the damage is done.  They're not gonna get any more dead no matter what you do.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: that is a great way to think about it.

name: slab64
text: Chubbied, for profundity.

name: lugosh
text: But what if you accidentally make them into a zombie?

name: ravindra108
text:
Just keep the Worcestershire Sauce safely stowed in the kitchen.


It's not pinkeye!

name: biznart
text: There have been a lot of incredible advances in topical cream in the past few years.

name: terriblerobot
text: SCREW YOU, ZOMBIE! FUCK YOU! has shown a lot of promise in recent clinical trials.

name: i_love_kate
text: Looks like another snake bite.

name: jackparsons
text: Read and watch "The Loved One". Evelyn Waugh/on DVD.

name: ford
text: it strikes me as one of those job that are reserved for people twisted a certain way-like proctologists and male gynecologists (Seriously, what dude wants to see it when it's sick?)

name: jocelynthepink
text: Well, most gynecologists are OB-GYNs and get to deliver babies, so I wouldn't say it's a perverted thing. I also like to think that many proctologists or gynecologists either had a parent in the same profession or a relative who died of a related disease (e.g. prostate cancer or cervical cancer). But I've clearly thought way too much about it.

name: i_love_kate
text: I'm guessing that the thinking in question as when you were being examined by your male obstetrician.

name: i_love_kate
text: [i[]Was[/i] when. Sigh.

name: i_love_kate
text: Oh...

name: spicyponyhead
text:
I used to have a male OBGYN who was a college buddy of my boyfriend. I asked him once "Why are you an OBGYN?" and he said "I love pussy".

So there ya go.

name: hateandwar
text: So was this during an examination?

name: sharktastic
text: That lends support to my theory that male gynocologists are just in it to look at girls' boobs and vajayjays.

name: soticoto
text: Is it ok if I high five a police sniper while he is aiming?

name: cuddlepaw
text: Did Philippe write Blue Whale because he is uncomfortable writing "Sperm"?

name: ggvaidya
text: Perhaps! Although it does say "sperm whale" on the illustration itself ...

name: falseprophet
text: I think he's worried about what Cornelius would say.

name: heccibiggs
text:
OH MAN THAT'S SO CRAZY I'm clicking the random link, and that was the last one that came up before this one, and then you're all referencing it here...

Well I thought it was cool.

name: pogo
text: He obviously doesn't know the blue is a krill sucker.

name: epicurus
text: Teodor's analysis of tree pain is well-put. I used to be  obssessed with Giant squid when I was a kid; the squid could totally win sometimes!

name: neonaoneo
text: The squid never wins...

name: epicurus
text: Come say that to my face, I dare you! FUCK YOU, MIKE!

name: neonaoneo
text: DUDE IT'S JUST SCIENCE KAY IF THE SQUID WON IT WOULD TOTALLY BE UN-SCIENCE. Like...NEGA Science.

name: epicurus
text: SON YOU WANNA STEP OFF YOU BETTER LEARN TO SWIM IN A HURRY BWAH I FOLD YOUR ASS UP LIKE A OL' WALLET

name: nigelchaos
text: Epicurus and Neonaoneo - thank you for proving ONCE again how *great* the internet is! :-D

name: epicurus
text: Actually reading this again warms my shrivelled heart. Is it really bad when both people involved are writing sarcasically?

name: neonaoneo
text: Babycakes you know it alright

name: epicurus
text: And now we have make-up sex on the internet for all to see, as God intended when he invented ironic flaming.

name: pogo
text: XD

name: nigelchaos
text: don't worry.. I think we ALL saw the flaming.. .... I'm sorry. hahah.

name: epicurus
text: Dude ain't be hatin' on a little straight-up bromance if it be strictly biannual in nature, feelin' me?

name: greenkoolayd
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: bluemoon72
text: Just look at the satisfied smile, the confident eyes, that come with the knowledge of swingin' death between one's legs.

name: greenkoolayd
text: what are you talking about?

name: bluemoon72
text: That's Dustin Diamond, right?  He's well known for packing quite a salami.  LOL

name: greenkoolayd
text:
yes. i posted it becasue that dude looks like him.

oh... i could have gone my whole life without knowing that.

name: bluemoon72
text: I hope I have not instigated any feelings of inadequacy . LOL

name: greenkoolayd
text: nah.  im not built like a farm animal down there, but ive got enough.

name: bluemoon72
text: Not even a rooster?  I WIN.

name: greenkoolayd
text: [[rolls eyes]] fiiiine.  you win.

name: bluemoon72
text: A field mouse doesn't count as a farm animal exactly, does it? I am cracking myself UP.

name: greenkoolayd

name: teknofatcat
text: A comment left by teknofatcat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by pityparty, Jesus, angelaw6745, Zem)

name: selbencoirlo
text: CDs still feel a little sci-fi to me. I still contend that anything with a laser component is PROBABLY from the future.

name: tttt2
text: Lyle is such a dick

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Naw, that sorta thing rules for kids. Happened to me- I was Philippe and Lyle was my dad, except it was a shot and he decided to film it, cackling appropriately.

name: senatorexlax
text: Haha, reminds me of when I was little and I wondered what beer tasted like so my dad let me have a sip. Of course I cringed and told him it was awful. His response: "yeah it tastes like shit, but I'll be damned if I don't love it."

name: libelandslander
text: Your father did not truly love beer.

name: hateandwar
text: Go have a couple of kids, you'll understand how one can come to deeply and truly love beer.

name: molesticide
text:
promise to grind their fist really slowly and carefully into your mouth

"promise" and "carefully" make that one for me.

name: deovalente
text: I agree.  Without them, the sentence would merely be "to grind their fist really slowly and into your mouth."

name: k_buttsworthe
text: phillipe is a regular h. bogart with that smoke in his mouth. looks like he just got done calling molly 'dollface'.

name: honesttom
text: 5 for the mortician fact.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: This is the best friday facts.

name: cailetshadow
text: It is true that I have never seen an image of a squid winning one of these fights. I wonder if it is a Freudian thing.

name: stayawaystars
text: Do 5-year-olds even know what tapes are these days?

name: boredom_man
text: I bet Philippe does, given that Cornelius is hella old school, Teodor is Gen-X nostalgic, and Todd still does coke to Dokken.

name: libelandslander
text: But cassettes aren't that old school. Would it not make more sense for Cornelius to listen to Wax Cylinders?

name: boredom_man
text: Hm, good point. But Nice Pete, I recall, definitely listens to tapes. And he and Philippe take van rides together.

name: libelandslander
text:
I wasn't disagreeing with the whole comment, just the idea that Mr. Bear's hella old school-ness would = cassette tapes.
Also, I think about wax cylinders a lot.

name: boredom_man
text: They can be used as flexible and travel-safe storage units or to help small pets get to difficult locations.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Philippe wants to watch old ladies die.

name: soticoto
text: The implication of a special room under churches is probably that they're still alive when they're buried.

name: hypoluxa
text: Two days until I follow the advice of the alt text....

name: soticoto
text:
Philippe has been watching The Lawnmower Man...

... and doesn't know such as a Sperm Whale.

name: cjfoster
text: "inside my neck" - this is a very five-year-old thing

name: akarroa
text: THAT THERE IS A SPERM WHALE.

name: nonanon
text: I just love that Philippe believes there is some police officer whose sole job is to find people jumping from high buildings and shoot them before they hit the pavement.

name: nickb285
text: Suicide is apparently a capital offense.

name: benthecartoon
text: Well, Lie-bot told him so!

name: fermatprime
text: "Lie Bot, what is the saddest job?"

name: jaldor
text: That is radical!

name: coke_hakola
text: My favorite part of this strip is that Africa Corner is shamelessly displayed in the middle of the page.

name: tbtabby
text: When I saw this YouTube vid, I immediately thought of this particular edition of Friday Facts.

name: bavarious
text: late to the party, but the lack of underlines on the text sections of "Africa Corner" really make it for me.
